Main Purpose Of Job Job Description (Roles and Responsibilities)This new position will drive forward the UK’s economic and climate diplomacy in Ecuador, at a time when the opportunity for bilateral engagement is growing and as the UK prepares to host COP 26. Following the signature of the UK-Andean Trade Agreement in May 2019, both countries are keen to work more closely together to encourage stronger trade and investment ties – this job plays a key role in that process. Environmental cooperation is a priority within the relaunched bilateral relationship, and the preparations for COP 26 place it at the centre of the Embassy’s focus for the months ahead.The jobholder will be responsible for a Prosperity Fund allocation of £115,000, and will oversee the delivery of high quality projects to improve the business environment for UK companies and encourage sustainable growth in Ecuador. The officer will ensure funds are spent in accordance with guidance for maximum policy impact, and will also lead work to access other funding streams (for example in support of biodiversity objectives).The role requires a significant degree of autonomy in decision making and delivering results, while also being able to collaborate effectively across teams – for example ensuring that colleagues from the Department for International Trade are closely involved in business environment work. The jobholder will develop strong networks across Gov’t, the private sector and the NGO community in order to understand policy context. Roles and responsibilities / what will the jobholder be expected to achieve?: To lead UK engagement on climate policy and biodiversity.   To design and implement programmes in support of Ecuador’s aspirations to join the OECD and Pacific Alliance in order to improve business environment for British companies.  To act as UK focal point in Ecuador in support of HMRC-led negotiations towards a Double Taxation Agreement with the Ecuadorean Internal Revenue Service.  To lead Embassy engagement to support Ecuador’s transparency and anti-corruption programmes.  To encourage the development of a sustainable and responsible mining sector, in support of DIT commercial interests. Essential qualifications, skills and experienceEssential On Arrival University degree in a related field.  Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey information concisely both orally and in writing.   Project management experience, including strong budgeting and forecasting skills  Ability to build broad networks with senior stakeholders.   Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to work effectively in and across diverse teams.   Track record of delivering results without close supervision while ensuring careful attention to detail.  Flexibility and ability to work on several projects concurrently.  A readiness to promote Embassy values – respect, resilience, creativity and collaboration. Language RequirementsLanguage: Spanish and EnglishLevel of language required: Fluent both orally and in writingMust have – or be able to obtain – legal status to live and work in Ecuador.Required competencies Seeing the Big Picture, Leading and Communicating, Collaborating and Partnering, Delivering at Pace Application deadline Application deadline - day Application deadline - month Application deadline - year 2 June 2020 Grade C4 (L) Type of Position Full-time Working hours per week 35 Location (City) Quito Type of Post British Embassy Number of vacancies 1 Starting monthly salary () $2600 Start Date Start Date - day Start Date - month Start Date - year 20 July 2020 Other benefits and conditions of employment Learning and development opportunities   (and any specific training courses to be completed): Likely regional conferences to build networks across the Economic Diplomacy and Climate Change Network in the Americas.   The jobholder will also have access to online training opportunities via the FCO’s Diplomatic Academy.Please be aware that you will only be able to apply to vacancies for Local Staff roles with the British Government through this official tal.net site (operated by Oleeo). Jobs may be advertised on third party websites, however our adverts will always link back to the official tal.net site. If you complete and send an application through any other site, we will not receive it.

Company DescriptionAs the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.Job DescriptionThe Business Development Coordinator will be responsible for executing a set of responsibilities to provide analytical and business development support with key client and market focused initiatives aimed at achieving Visa’s growth targets in Ecuador. This role will report directly to the Country Manager for EcuadorResponsibilities Client Management Contribute in the execution of short and long-term strategic plans for clients and market. Ensure that such plans adhere to Visa mission statement of increasing clients’ profitability, strengthening the partnership within them, and also being in agreement with Visa Inc. overall strategy Have solid understanding of client views on development of banking and financial services industry; understand clients’ strategies, priorities, needs and business processes Evaluate and recommend actions to strengthen partnerships and client business when appropriate Develop a comprehensive understanding of all Visa products and services Manage/Coordinate Client requests such as: trainings, demos, webinars, membership processes, card designs, collaterals, NDAs, among others Maintain close contact with all Visa’s areas in order to search for solutions for the most critical problems, as well as to follow best practices that could be offered and applied to the clients and the market Client Incentives Lead processing of incentive payments, including VIK requirements, Market Development Funds, as well as internal finance back office process for incentive payments. Develop and maintain client incentive tracking mechanism at the client level, for internal and client use. Create client incentive use reports for client presentations. Reporting & analytics: Creation of quarterly performance reports for quarterly business reviews use Recurring business intelligence reports, including top merchants, top categories by market, product type, e-commerce, domestic vs international, etc. Creation of ad-hoc reports and analysis to support client strategies and follow up on Client’s projects progressPlaybook and client/internal communicationsSupport the Sales Team to update contacts, profiles and general information in PlaybookLead client engagement survey, visa payments forum client campaign, reporting, and follow-upsDevelop and administer quarterly client newsletter, including wins, losses, and important updates, for internal management useSupport the Sales Team with internal information requests related to Clients and MarketOther responsibilitiesCoordinate Client events to be held in market: logistics, follow required internal processes and ensure alignment with compliance requirements, attendant invitations and follow ups, coordinate with internal functional teams involved in each eventCoordinate agendas for Functional Teams visits to marketCoordinate office supplies and daily requests in the officeFinanceSupport budget, forecast and financial analysis reviews for EcuadorQualificationsProfessionally qualified with 5+ years’ experience, preferable in business development, sales support, finance, or equivalent combination of education and experience; undergraduate degree requiredExcellent verbal and writing skills in English and SpanishPayments industry or consumer banking experience is desiredCustomer service-focused with ability to work collaboratively with others. Flexible withan approachable personalityConsulting skills and client engagement capabilitiesStrong credibility, with the ability to quickly become knowledgeable of Visa products and servicesStrong financial acumen, planning and analytical skillsSolid business judgmentStrong teamwork and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively with inter-disciplinary groupsAbility to multi-task and prioritize work with a strong attention to detail.The ability to cooperate effectively and efficiently in a challenging, fast-paced environmentwith little supervision.Additional InformationVisa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.Job Number: REF23626V

MisiónGestionar la implementación y mantenimiento de los procesos de las Unidades de Negocios / Áreas de Servicio, asegurando el cumplimiento de los requisitos legales y regulatorios que apliquen y demás normativas de gestión vigentes.Funciones Gestión de Procesos Asegurar el mantenimiento y mejora del Sistema de Gestión de la Calidad, cumpliendo con los requisitos legales / regulatorios y los establecidos por la norma ISO 9001 vigente. Dar soporte y coordinar el levantamiento y documentación de los procesos de las UN/AS, asegurando el cumplimiento de los requisitos legales / regulatorias y los establecidos por las normas de gestión que apliquen. Coordinar la administración y control de la documentación del Sistema de Gestión, en cumplimiento con el procedimiento de administración establecido y los requisitos legales y regulatorios aplicables. Apoyar en los proyectos de implementación de nuevos modelos de gestión. Apoyar en la implementación de los requisitos de los Acuerdos de Calidad de Clientes y/o Representadas, así como de nuevos requerimientos legales y regulatorios.  Gestión de Auditorías Desarrollar la planificación y ejecución de los Programas y Planes de Auditorías Internas. Preparar informe de los hallazgos identificados y realizar seguimiento a los Planes de acción de acuerdo a las fechas propuestas. Dar soporte documental en las Auditorías Externas de Clientes, Representadas y/o Autoridades Sanitarias, apoyando el cumplimiento de los requerimientos en cada una de éstas.  RequisitosGraduado de carreras universitarias Ingeniería Industrial, de Procesos o carreras afines.Entre 3 a 5 años en cargos similaresConocimiento Experiencia en levantamiento y documentación de procesos. Manejo de desviaciones, acciones correctivas y preventivas. Manejo de herramientas de calidad. Formación en Auditorías Internas y de Sistemas Integrados de Gestión. Inglés intermedio.  BeneficiosBeneficios Corporativos de la empressa.Quifatex, somos una empresa con más de 40 años de experiencia brindando soluciones comerciales y logísticas a través de la distribución y representación de productos de salud y consumo de compañías líderes a nivel mundial.Generamos trabajo a más de 700 familias ecuatorianas y somos una de las 50 empresas más grandes del país.Somos parte del grupo Intercorp, con más de 38,000 colaboradores en países de la región andina.

Chemonics seeks an Ecuador country manager for the anticipated USAID-funded South America Regional Initiative for Transnational Conservation Crimes program, based in Peru, with a regional focus on the Amazon Basin. The program will support collaboration and innovation among governments, the private sector, and civil society across the six Amazon Basin countries to address conservation crimes and cross-border trade in illegal natural resource commodities and to enhance incentives for licit Amazon supply chains. We are looking for individuals who have a passion for making a difference in the lives of people around the world.  Responsibilities include:  Direct, supervise, and provide strategic analysis of and reporting on program activities and operations in Ecuador to ensure the project achieves its objectives Liaise with stakeholders in Ecuador and counterparts in other Amazon Basin countries to ensure the application of approaches and delivery of results across the region Serve as a senior advisor and report to the chief of party  Qualifications:  Advanced degree in international development, environmental law, natural resource management, public administration, business administration, finance, public policy, or a related field Minimum of 10 years of experience in public administration, natural resource management, supply chains, commerce, or data and information management with demonstrated field experience advancing national and regional efforts to combat transnational conservation crimes in the Amazon Basin; an equivalent mix of experience and education will be considered Knowledge of regional, national, and international frameworks for countering transnational conservation crimes in the Amazon biome Hands-on experience working with domestic and international stakeholders, including rural communities, to increase incentives for legal Amazonian supply chains and reduce demand for illegal commodities Deep understanding of the opportunities and barriers to investigating, preparing judicial cases on, and adequately sanctioning environmental crimes in the Amazon biome Proven experience navigating complex and high-pressure operating environments Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both orally and in writing Demonstrated leadership, versatility, and integrity Fluency in Spanish and English; knowledge of Portuguese preferred  Application instructions:  Please submit your CV and cover letter to AmazonTCCrecruit@chemonics.com with “Ecuador Country Manager” in the subject line. No telephone inquiries, please.  Chemonics values the protection of your personal data. If you are in the European Union, please read our EU Recruiting Data Privacy Notice to learn how we process personal data. You may access the notice via the following link: https://chemonics.com/eu-recruiting-data-privacy-notice/.  Chemonics is an equal opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate in its selection and employment practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, or protected veteran status, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, or other non-merit factors.

Successful candidates must have a long-term vision and strategy that establishes the foundation as the global thought leader in science, conservation and sustainable development for the equatorial Pacific (Puerto Ayora, Galápagos, Ecuador).Experience working closely with a Board of Directors and with the governing body of an organization.Ability to formulate and articulate an inspiring vision that attracts, motivates, and empowers stakeholders from a diverse range of backgrounds.Five years of experience in successful non-profit fundraising and senior management. Record of securing 5-, 6- and 7-figure gifts.At least five years experience leading a non-profit organization preferred.A record of having conducted or supervised "world-class" science.A record of success in establishing and executing fundraising goals and strategies, identifying and analyzing challenges, and formulating creative solutions that generate organizational excellence.Experience creating and managing a budget; commitment to fiscal responsibility.Experience in all aspects of personnel management, including recruitment, assessment, and termination when necessary, and organizational development.Experience with national and community relations in Ecuador preferred.Experience ensuring gender equality and incorporating gender perspectives in the workplace.Science Ph.D. preferred. In-Country Coordinator, based in Quito, Ecuador Timeframe: Currently one-year assignment (possible renewal)OVERVIEWThe Global Health Advocacy Incubator (GHAI), a program of the Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids, provides strategic advocacy assistance on global public health issues that include road safety. Road traffic crashes is the leading cause of death of people between the ages of 5 years and 29 years of age killing approximately 1.5 million people annually with 90% of the deaths occurring in low to middle income countries. The GHAI advances policy change that saves lives on the road by addressing five of the leading risk factors (speed, drink driving, helmet usage, child restraints and seat belts). GHAI also works with the Global Road Safety Partnership (GRSP) to help identify promising individuals and organizations to serve as advocates for road safety policy change and provide technical assistance, training and strategic planning to help advocates conduct high-impact campaigns. The In-Country Coordinator (ICC) in Ecuador will work in partnership with civil society organizations and multilateral organizations to advocate for policy change and engage in regulatory reforms that aim to improve road safety.OBJECTIVEThe ideal ICC will have had experience working with the government of Ecuador and have a good sense of the political and media landscape. He/She will have knowledge of the policy-making process in Ecuador, and ideally a background in public health and/or advocacy; a proven ability to develop and work in partnership with multiple stakeholders; and, experience in working with government agencies and officials. This is a full-time coordinator position (20 to 22 days each month for 12 months) and will be based in Quito, Ecuador. PRIMARY DUTIESThe ICC provides technical assistance, training and strategic planning to help advocates conduct high-impact campaigns and must therefore harmonize the work of Global Road Safety Partnership (GRSP) grantees and the contractors funded by GHAI to advance comprehensive road safety policies in Ecuador. The primary duties include the following: Apply a strong working knowledge of Ecuadorian political and administrative systems, process and players to identify opportunities for change in policies, specifically as it relates to ensuring road safety in Ecuador;Track and monitor developments regarding road safety measures in Ecuador;Engage in a proactive approach with GRSP grantees by assisting with the development of political analysis and political mapping, as well as building relationships with key government officials and political leaders;Provide hands-on advice in the Ecuadorian context on challenges and opportunities in the legislative process;Translate concepts and provide cultural and social nuance to these concepts; share and disseminate information to both GRSP grantees and GHAI staff;Suggest strategies (direct contact, media, public education) for providing evidence and best practices to support government officials and policymakers;Facilitate meetings with GRSP grantees and partners for joint strategy formulation and execution;Proactively and closely engage with GRSP grantees to help them capitalize on new developments in Ecuador and other countries and into implementable project activities to move the agenda forward;Identify new organizations to engage in road safety efforts in Ecuador;Work collaboratively and share intelligence with local and global partners, including GHAI and GRSP;Participate in regional cross-learning opportunities with advocates in existing GHAI road safety countries;Participate in weekly virtual meetings with GHAI/GRSP;Help organize workshops, trainings and meetings, and take on other duties as needed; and,Perform other relevant tasks that may be assigned by the GHAI Regional Advocacy Director.Some international and local travel is required to successfully conduct the ICC’s primary duties.REPORTINGAt the end of each month, ICC will provide a monthly activity report detailing specific activities, meetings attended, campaign progress and other details in accordance with the position’s primary duties.REQUIREMENTSBachelor (at minimum) or Master’s degree (preferred) in public health or public policy, law degree or other related degree with global focus highly desirable;A minimum of 7 years of professional experience coordinating and managing a wide variety of projects including advocacy or policy change;Strong understanding of political and media environments;Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment while juggling multiple projects and deadlines;Commitment to public health and public interest work; road safety knowledge and experience preferred;Ability to communicate complex issues in a concise, compelling, and easily understandable manner both verbally and in writing;Strong interpersonal and organizational skills;Proven ability to work effectively and collaboratively as a member of a dynamic and dispersed team;Ability to work effectively and to report and communicate regularly and promptly with supervisor in a long-distance management setting;A track record of working in an empowering and culturally sensitive style with an array of partners and stakeholders; and,Proven ability to translate organizational program strategies, priorities, plans and budgets into results-oriented action plans at country-level.TO APPLYTo apply for this position, please email a cover letter and resume and salary requirement. Please reference the position code: ICC/E/GHAI/12 in the subject line of your email. Applications will be accepted through June 15, 2020. No phone calls please.

Beneficios Paquete salarial de acuerdo al mercado laboral Beneficios de ley  Seguro de vida privado INDUSTRIAS ALES es una empresa dedicada a la producción y comercialización de productos de consumo masivo e industriales. Desde nuestro origen en 1943, estamos presentes en los hogares ecuatorianos con productos de alta calidad dirigidos a mejorar la vida de las familias en cada momento de su día. A través de uno de los mejores sistemas de distribución del país, atendemos a nuestros consumidores y clientes a nivel nacional.Nuestro portafolio incluye marcas locales ampliamente valoradas y reconocidas como Ales en Jabones y Alesol en Aceites & Mantecas. Además, comercializamos en el territorio nacional marcas líderes globales y regionales en las categorías de Cuidado Personal (H&S, Pantene, Guillette, Oral B, entro otras), Cuidado del Hogar (FAB), vía alianzas estratégicas con Procter & Gamble e Industrias La Popular, respectivamente.Producimos y comercializamos productos especializados y semielaborados derivados de las grasas vegetales (aceites y mantecas) desarrolladas a la medida de las necesidades de nuestros clientes, contando con una amplia aceptación a nivel nacional e internacional.En Industrias Ales promovemos un ambiente de trabajo fuertemente sustentado por los valores de integridad, orientación a resultados, trabajo en equipo y compromiso con nuestros clientes y proveedores. Buscamos procesos industriales sustentables con foco en el respeto por el medio ambiente y la mejora del desarrollo económico de la comunidad.

Desarrollar, analizar y controlar las líneas de negocio asignadas con el fin de lograr el mix óptimo de productos y estrategias necesarias que generen la máxima rentabilidad para la organización.FORMACIÓN ACADÉMICA  Titulado o cursando último año de estudios universitarios en Ingeniería Comercial, Negocios Internacionales, Administración de Empresa, Marketing o Comunicación y Publicidad. EXPERIENCIA Tres (3) años de experiencia mínimo en labores comerciales, compras o de marketing.SOLIDOS CONOCIMIENTOS EN  Marketing estratégico Planeación Comercial Construcción y desarrollo de marcas Diseño de campañas y publicidad Cubos de información  Office avanzadoCOMPETENCIAS  Liderazgo Desarrollo de personas Manejo de Conflictos con clientes  Negociación Solución de problemas Adaptación al cambio Servicio al cliente Empowerment Proactividad LA EMPRESA OFRECE  Alimentación Transporte Plan de carrera FUNCIONES A REALIZAR  Crear y desarrollar estrategias competitivas de marketing, logrando posicionar e impulsar las líneas a su cargo en el mercado. Conocer plenamente sobre la línea a cargo y mantenerse actualizado de las tendencias del mercado. Mantener un portafolio de productos dentro de los rangos de rentabilidad óptimos para la empresa. Mantener un índice de cobertura e inventario de acuerdo a las necesidades comerciales. Asegurar una buena comunicación de la línea al cliente interno y externo, logrando un buen reconocimiento del mismo. Cumplir y hacer cumplir a su equipo de trabajo todas las políticas establecidas por la empresa. Promover y facilitar el desarrollo de su equipo de trabajo cuidando el clima laboral. Cumplir con cualquier otra actividad que Gerencia requiera. Seguimiento y plan de acción para el desarrollo de su línea (Venta, Compra, Postventa, Inventario, Marketing). Monitorear continuamente el mercado, identificando necesidades de ajustar condiciones de venta (Precios). Coordinar la comunicación de información y novedades de la línea hacia al área comercial. Revisar y analizar indicadores de ventas de productos de líneas a cargo.  Investigar y desarrollar nuevos productos para el crecimiento de su línea. Control y seguimiento de compras locales e internacionales. Reunión con Fuerza de Ventas para retroalimentación de productos (Nuevos, Baja rotación, De segunda, Novedades) de la línea encargada. Análisis e investigación de los precios del mercado, competencia y necesidades de los clientes. Monitorear y comunicar resultados de venta de los productos a su cargo con relación a su presupuesto. Crear y realizar seguimiento de proyectos de desarrollo procurando el posicionamiento de la marca. Seguimiento y mejoramiento de los planes de desarrollo de líneas a cargo. Control y seguimiento del presupuesto mensual establecido (Compra y Venta). Revisión de indicadores de cumplimiento de la línea. Desarrollar estrategia y planes de marketing según necesidades de cada canal. Generar y revisar órdenes de compra. Seguimiento del abastecimiento de los productos de la línea a cargo. Reportar rentabilidad de los productos de la línea a cargo. Presentación a Gerencia de reporte de resultados del presupuesto. Análisis completo de productos nuevos Presentar presupuestos generales (Compra y Venta) de la línea para el año siguiente. Presentar a Gerencia resultados generales del periodo anterior de líneas a cargo. Presentar plan de marketing de líneas asignadas para el año siguiente. Somos una empresa dedicada a la importación directa, distribución y comercialización de productos varios. Herederos de la empresa TOGEN que apostó en el Ecuador desde 1987. Nuestro objetivo es desarrollar el Negocio Ideal convirtiéndonos en el líder del mercado Latino Americano en las líneas que manejamos, y para ello trabajamos con la filosofía TOGEN C.A. “Toda Operación Genera Energía Nueva Con Amor”. Con nuestras divisiones de ferretería, consumo, llantas y maquinaria pesada ofrecemos una amplia gama de productos, mejorando continuamente.Nuestro propósito es brindar facilidades y beneficios a las personas a través de una gran diversidad de líneas y productos, ofreciendo siempre una alternativa diferente, mejor e innovadora para nuestros clientes.El nombre Soyoda proviene de los caracteres chinos 寿友达 (Shou You Da) “Shou You – Larga Amistad” “Da – Desarrollo”

Company DescriptionAs the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers. You're an Individual.  We're the team for you.  Together , let's transform the way the world pays.Job Description And Responsibilities The Business Development Coordinator will be responsible for executing a set of responsibilities to provide analytical and business development support with key client and market focused initiatives aimed at achieving Visa’s growth targets in Ecuador. This role will report directly to the Country Manager for EcuadorResponsibilities Client ManagementContribute in the execution of short and long-term strategic plans for clients and market. Ensure that such plans adhere to Visa mission statement of increasing clients’ profitability, strengthening the partnership within them, and also being in agreement with Visa Inc. overall strategyHave solid understanding of client views on development of banking and financial services industry; understand clients’ strategies, priorities, needs and business processesEvaluate and recommend actions to strengthen partnerships and client business when appropriateDevelop a comprehensive understanding of all Visa products and servicesManage/Coordinate Client requests such as: trainings, demos, webinars, membership processes, card designs, collaterals, NDAs, among othersMaintain close contact with all Visa’s areas in order to search for solutions for the most critical problems, as well as to follow best practices that could be offered and applied to the clients and the market Client IncentivesLead processing of incentive payments, including VIK requirements, Market Development Funds, as well as internal finance back office process for incentive payments.Develop and maintain client incentive tracking mechanism at the client level, for internal and client use.Create client incentive use reports for client presentations. Reporting & analytics:Creation of quarterly performance reports for quarterly business reviews useRecurring business intelligence reports, including top merchants, top categories by market, product type, e-commerce, domestic vs international, etc.Creation of ad-hoc reports and analysis to support client strategies and follow up on Client’s projects progress Playbook and client/internal communicationsSupport the Sales Team to update contacts, profiles and general information in PlaybookLead client engagement survey, visa payments forum client campaign, reporting, and follow-upsDevelop and administer quarterly client newsletter, including wins, losses, and important updates, for internal management useSupport the Sales Team with internal information requests related to Clients and Market  Other responsibilitiesCoordinate Client events to be held in market: logistics, follow required internal processes and ensure alignment with compliance requirements, attendant invitations and follow ups, coordinate with internal functional teams involved in each eventCoordinate agendas for Functional Teams visits to marketCoordinate office supplies and daily requests in the office  FinanceSupport budget, forecast and financial analysis reviews for EcuadorQualifications Professionally qualified with 5+ years’ experience, preferable in business development, sales support, finance, or equivalent combination of education and experience; undergraduate degree required  Excellent verbal and writing skills in English and Spanish  Payments industry or consumer banking experience is desired  Customer service-focused with ability to work collaboratively with others. Flexible withan approachable personality  Consulting skills and client engagement capabilities  Strong credibility, with the ability to quickly become knowledgeable of Visa products and services  Strong financial acumen, planning and analytical skills  Solid business judgment  Strong teamwork and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively with inter-disciplinary groups  Ability to multi-task and prioritize work with a strong attention to detail.  The ability to cooperate effectively and efficiently in a challenging, fast-paced environmentwith little supervision.Additional InformationVisa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

SCOPE OF WORKProject Name: Civil Society Assistance ProgramPeriod of Performance: July 2019Number of Days: Not to exceed 14 daysRequesting Resumes for: Financial Sustainability and Organizational Development SupportBackgroundThe Civil Society Assistance (“CSA”) Program is a USAID-funded program implemented by Counterpart International in Ecuador which aims to support, strengthen, and sustain the critical work of civil society organizations in increasing broad-based citizen engagement with national and local government. Counterpart will support a small group of experienced Ecuadorean civil society organizations (CSOs) to achieve this goal through the following objectives: 1) increase civil society engagement to promote transparency and accountability at the municipal and national levels; 2) expand citizen engagement with central and municipal government as allowed under Ecuadorean law, and 3) strengthen the technical and financial capacity of CSOs and in their efforts to establish mutual support networks and set examples of transparency and accountability to maintain CSOs’ independence.Within the scope of objective 3, Counterpart conducted a baseline Organizational Development (OD) assessment on three local CSOs in 2014, a mid-term assessment in 2016, and a final assessment in June 2019. This consultancy will provide follow-up support for the OD process in Ecuador, ensuring that the three partners successfully create sustainability plans that reflect the outcomes of the OD assessment.ResponsiblitiesThe consultant will be responsible for both remote and in-person support that will include but is not limited to the followingThe Project is seeking one (1) local consultant to provide technical assistance and support to three local partner civil society organizations to create action plans and strategies with a focus on financial sustainability. The action plans should reflect the outcomes of their June 2019 OD assessments and include innovative ideas for the partner’s sustainability strategies.Work with the organizations to outline their action plans and sustainability strategiesReview partner’s OD plans and provide feedback to them on how to include financial sustainability strategies Support partner’s in identify financial sustainability actions and strategies Review draft sustainability plans and providing technical inputsBeing available to answer questions from the organizations related to this consultancy, either through phone, email, or in person meetingsRequirementsLocal to EcuadorSpanish speaker; English Proficiency Experience in creating Financial Sustainability PlansMinimum of five (5) years of experience working in non-governmental organizational programsExperience working at or with civil society organizations in Latin AmericaMinimum of five (5) years experience developing sustainability strategies for non profit organizationsFamiliarity with Microsoft suite of products, including Word, Excel, and PowerPointAbility to work independently as well as in a team environmentPreferredPrevious experience with Counterpart International’s OD and/or Financial Sustainability methodology.

About ToptalToptal is a global network of top talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun (see this video from The Huffington Post). We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.Position DescriptionAs a Communications Specialist, be the first point of contact for network applicants. Your professional, ambitious, and friendly communication style will engage applicants and convey to them an outstanding brand image. You will be instrumental in ensuring each new Toptaler, hired to our network, has outstanding English skills. Through in-depth assessment of an individual’s communication, the team will quickly gain confidence in your ability to screen out candidates whose English is not as superb as your own. Demonstrating your captivating communication style and establishing a quick connection with candidates over video calls will be critical to your success and ability to efficiently identify if a candidate is a Toptal fit.Work with applicants across disciplines, including developers, designers, finance experts, and project managers. Your enthusiasm for connecting with applicants and efficiently move them along in the process or figure out there is not a mutual fit will guarantee an organized process and positive applicant experience. You understand, with each interaction, that you are the face of Toptal. You must ensure incoming Toptalers meet the high standard that we require for Toptal’s brand image.This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Only resumes and communication submitted in English will be considered.ResponsibilitiesEnsure you have an organized and efficient process as you connect with applicants to assess their English skills. You will self-manage your schedule and understand how to follow through on your assigned tasks! You will engage with candidates all over the world and the emotional intelligence to understand and adapt to a variety of cultural norms and nuances in communication styles. You will remain professional at all times through both your written and verbal communication, and you will always keep applicant experience at the forefront of your mind, ensuring everyone leaves interactions with you with a good impression of Toptal.In The First Week, Expect To Onboard and integrate into Toptal. Begin an extensive training where you will learn about the interviewing process. Familiarize yourself with the tools used for English screening calls. In The First Month, Expect To Finish your training with the team. Start conducting a handful of interviews per day, on your own, to get familiar with processes and the pace of the work. In The First Three Months, Expect To Have a general understanding of developer and designer profiles. Become a confident user of the platform, interviewing tools, and resources. Increase the number of your daily calls so you can reach your full capacity. Be familiar and comfortable with the management of your daily workload. In The First Six Months, Expect To Have a solid understanding of all processes related to specific verticals. Begin an advanced training to learn about the screening process additional verticals. In The First Year, Expect To Have a complete understanding of outlined processes for all verticals. Become eligible to mentor new hires. Requirements Your positive attitude and interpersonal skills are something you will bring to work with you daily. Possess extraordinary written and verbal communication skills. Possess superb command of the English language. Experience with and comfort conducting video calls. Understand and value the importance of operational efficiency. Be highly organized. Possess the ability to communicate with teams via Slack and other collaboration tools. Experience working in the technology industry preferred. Be comfortable with technology systems and tools. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with constant change and continuous improvement Experience working 100% remote preferred. Be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. We do not hire someone just to tell other people what to do! For Toptal Use Only: #europe #southamerica

BairesDev is the leading software development company in the Americas. With more than 1000 employees working on projects around the world, a sustained average annual growth of over 50%, and recognized by Inc. in the Top 10 Silicon Valley fastest-growing private companies, BairesDev is guiding the digital transformation of some of the top companies in the world, such as Google, Rolls-Royce, Pinterest, EY, SiriusXM, Motorola & ViacomCBS.Recognized by Clutch.co as a Top B2B Technology Services Company, BairesDev has offices across the United States, Canada, Europe, and Latin America and offers an exceptional work environment in which employees can thrive, working in multicultural teams, with flexible schedules and endless growth opportunities.BairesDev is on a mission to offer world-class Custom Software Development services. The company employs only the Top 1% IT Talent to create solid engineering teams that provide end-to-end delivery of Technology Solutions. Be prepared to work alongside industry leaders on cutting-edge projects in a fast-paced, innovative environment.We are looking for Project Managers SR to join the Management team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive, dynamic people and team players, with great organizational capacity, accustomed to handle multiple tasks and with marked attention to details. It is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry!Main Activities:- Develop the forecast of the projects in charge.- Follow and control project management using agile methodologies.- Ensure the application of consistent HR policies, in close collaboration with HRBP.- Verify the viability and prepare budgets, equipment and resources.- Identify and manage risks to ensure that delivery arrives on time.- Ensure compliance by your team of established methodologies and processes.- Implement the necessary changes throughout the process.- Carry out monitoring and control activities to track the progress of the project.- Ensure customer and team satisfaction throughout the entire project.What are we looking for:- 4+ years of experience in managing software outsourcing projects (experience in Personnel, Time and Materials and Budgets).- Customer oriented work.- Budget management.- IT experience.- Experience with Agile Methodology.- Strong communication skills.- Previous experience as a Software Engineer.- Bachelor of Software Engineering or Computer Science.Perks:- Excellent compensation plan, well above the market average.- Possibility of remote work and flexible schedules.- Training plans.- Extensive possibilities for growth and professional development thanks to our mentoring system.If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

¡En Ecuaquímica nos encontramos en la búsqueda de profesionales talentosos como tú!Si te apasiona el área de Gestión del Talento, implementar estrategias de desarrollo organizacional e impulsar el talento, esta oportunidad es para ti. Descripción: Buscamos jóvenes talentos para que sean parte de SONDA, la empresa multinacional de Tecnología más grande de Latinoamérica. Si quieres ser parte de nuestro equipo, este es el lugar para ti.Nuestro Programa Fresh Graduates  te ofrece un proceso diferenciado de principio a fin: Contrato indefinido, una posición específica en un área crítica del negocio, capacitaciones diferenciadas durante el primer año, acompañamiento de tutores, managers y de la Gerencia de Personas, donde tendrás la oportunidad de participar en diferentes desafíos, que permitirán que crezcas rápidamente en nuestra empresa y seas parte de la nueva generación de SONDA.¿Por qué debes participar?Porque es tu oportunidad para comenzar a crecer en uno de los sectores más prometedores del futuro, donde las carreras relacionadas con la tecnología tendrán un lugar destacado.Podrás compatibilizar tus intereses y habilidades personales con una carrera profesional de gran importancia para la sociedad.Queremos sumar talento para el presente y futuro del mundo de la tecnología.Ven a dejar tu marca personal en SONDA.¿A quiénes buscamos? A ti, joven profesional recién titulado/a, sin experiencia laboral de la carrera de Ingeniería Civil Informática y/o en Computación, con motivación por aprender y desarrollar todo tu potencial en proyectos de TI dentro de variadas industrias y soluciones.Los/las candidatos/as que sean pre-seleccionados/as serán contactados por el Equipo de Reclutamiento y Selección de SONDA para participar en un Assessment Center

We are looking for a DATA SCIENCE SPECIALIST to be incorporated through JLL to our client team, a MULTINATIONAL TECHNOLOGY COMPANY.Zone- 100% Home Office.Schedule- Monday to Friday, 8-00 am to 5-00 pm.Overall RoleThe Data Scientist primary goal is to gather, normalize and structure data; use data science, algorithms and predictive/preemptive analytics to propose and provide quantitative support to decision-making process. Company DescriptionAs the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.Job DescriptionCome join Visa to be the steward of one on the leading Brands in the world. As Ecuador Client Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for leading the development and execution of Join Marketing Business Plans with strategic clients, coordinating the efforts of different internal and external stakeholders. You will also be responsible of supporting the implementation of the new Visa Marketing Service Model working in conjunction with the regional team.Responsibilities Lead the development and implementation of client marketing strategy the market. Partner with Consumer Marketing team in order to flawless execute key initiatives in the market. Build and enhance relationships across Product Management, Client Services, Merchant Marketing and Financial Institution Marketing to ensure effective implementation of joint marketing business plans, which might include among others: marketing campaigns, promotions, events marketing communications, sponsorships/partnerships, digital marketing and/or product development. Identify client’s actionable consumer insights and opportunities via research programs. Drive the strategic X-Selling and X Usage of the different global, regional and local sponsorships assets across Colombia clients Develop the local strategy and execution of the new Visa Marketing Service Model, including existing and new clients and/or contracts/RFPS. Continuously evaluate the model to identify opportunities areas to improve the model, the service and the process to implement it. Work with the Business Development Leaders to drive the usage of incentives (VIK and cash) by providing marketing recommendations that maximize the usage of Visa assets across the markets Lead the coordination and/or implementation of marketing for VCA Analytics plans. Lead the local activation of Visa’s key sponsorship assets; FIFA, NFL and the Olympics across clients, and look for opportunities to better leverage this assets continuously Work with finance, sourcing and media teams in order to implement an efficient agency model for client’s plans. Ensure compliance and process correctness of marketing department adhere to Visa key controls and brand standards. Be accountable for managing marketing budget, reporting, budget/contractual commitment tracking, and marketing program performance metric reporting Work with VCA to support in the implementation of End to End Solutions for key clients and marketing plans to support key VCA analysis Deliver marketing best practice to create a “Go Beyond” marketing team.Inspire, coordinate, and motivate local agency partners and direct reports to deliver best in class marketing programsQualifications 7+ years of brand and trade marketing experience, preferably in a multi-national company or financial institution. Experience working with issuers and/ or merchants to understand their business model Demonstrated track record of developing marketing strategies based on business objectives and executing marketing programs that delivered measurable business results. Commercial experience leading accounts development is preferable but not required. Ability to structure and manage complex projects and processes with multiple stakeholders at both senior and junior levels Passion and verifiable track record of leading change Strong analytical and problem solving skills with financial acumen and capacity to develop business models Demonstrated teamwork and relationship-building skills. Experience working with financial indicators to measure business performance including ROI and accurately forecasting sources of cost, revenue and risk with an ability to summarize business and financial data in a useful manner for planning and decision makingExperience managing and motivating external partners including agencies and clients.Ability to present with impact in English and Spanish.Additional InformationVisa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.Job Number: REF23302K

DescriptionSe busca una persona para ayudar en la construcción de dos cabañas sustentables, acá se implementará la técnica de construcción de super adobe y madera. Se requiere que tenga experiencia en carpintería y construcción. Se encuentra en 3.550 m.s.n.m en la cordillera occidental de los Andes , cerca del Volcán Chimborazo. Es una hacienda que practica la permacultura desde hace 15 años, Trabajamos con plantas medicinales y la restauración cultural de la zona. We are looking for people helping in the construction of 2 sustainable cabins , the construction technique is with "adobe" and wood. People with experience are required in carpentery and construction. The place is located at 3.550 meters above sea level, in the middle of the Andes , close to the biggest mountain in Ecuador, Chimborazo. This is a permaculture farm , that started 15 years ago , we work with medicinal plants and also generating a big impact in the culture of the community.Availability2020JanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDecMin. stay1 weekMax. stay1 year

ERA, líder mundial en reducción de costes en áreas no estratégicas, busca activamente profesionales con experiencia en una solida y variada en diversos sectores e industrias.  ¿Está buscando un nuevo comienzo? Operando desde 1992, Expense Reduction Analysts (ERA) es una empresa de consultoría global con más de 700 franquicias en más de 30 países. Apoyamos a las empresas a ahorrar en gastos generales, habiendo completado más de 30.000 proyectos en todo el mundo. ERA se especializan en más de cuarenta categorías de costos tales como seguros, gastos bancarios, costos laborales, flota y edificios.  ¿Por qué ERA? Ofrecemos lo mejor de ambos mundos: la libertad, la flexibilidad, la satisfacción en el trabajo y el control de ser autónomo. La metodología de Expense Reduction Analysts muestra el camino para encontrar el equilibrio financiero rápidamente y predecir dónde es posible lograr rentabilidad. Para ello, ponemos a su alcance procesos operativos, sistemas empresariales, software, bases de datos y herramientas optimizadas para usted. Los beneficios de ser un franquiciado ERA: ·       Una marca de renombre mundial  ·       La oportunidad de obtener un ingreso excepcional  ·       Apoyo con formación especializada·       Apoyo en marketing ·       Una red internacional de expertos que trabajan juntos y colaboran entre si  ·       Gastos totales bajos y la libertad de conformar su propio negocio ·       Una excelente relación franquiciador / franquiciado  ·       Un modelo de negocio probado y desarrollado durante más de 20 años Especialidades: ·       Planificación de costos  ·       Manejo de costos  ·       Gestión de contratos ·       Administración de recursos ·       Gestión de proveedores  ·       Gestión de los interesados ·       Gestión del cambio ·       Gestión del portafolio de proyectos  ·       Entrega del Proyecto  ·       Mejora de Procesos de Negocio  ·       Informes financieros ·       Previsión del presupuesto  Como un Franquiciado de ERA, usted está en el negocio por sí mismo, pero no por usted mismo. Si siempre ha soñado con ser su propio jefe y sacar partido de todas sus habilidades y experiencias para crear una empresa propia que sea rentable, poner en marcha una franquicia de optimización de costes de la mano de Expense Reduction Analysts podría brindarle la oportunidad que ha estado esperando. Si desea recibir mas información acerca de nuestra franquicia por favor contactar aAgustina FraquelliVP Franchise Sales Latin Americaafraquelli@expensereduction.com

Cargo: ONUMUJERES/ECU/PS/20-021 Consultoría Asistencia técnica para mejorar el cumplimiento de los permisos de paternidad y maternidad
Descripción: BackgroundANTECEDENTESONU Mujeres es la organización de las Naciones Unidas dedicada a promover la igualdad de género y el empoderamiento de las mujeres. Como defensora mundial de mujeres y niñas, ONU Mujeres fue establecida para acelerar el progreso que conllevará a mejorar las condiciones de vida de las mujeres y para responder a las necesidades que enfrentan en el mundo.La Entidad Se Centra En Cinco Áreas PrioritariasONU Mujeres apoya a los Estados Miembros de las Naciones Unidas en el establecimiento de normas internacionales para lograr la igualdad de género y trabaja con los gobiernos y la sociedad civil en la creación de leyes, políticas, programas y servicios necesarios para garantizar que se implementen los estándares con eficacia y que redunden en verdadero beneficio de las mujeres y las niñas en todo el mundo. Trabaja mundialmente para que los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible sean una realidad para las mujeres y las niñas, y promueve la participación de las mujeres en igualdad de condiciones en todos los ámbitos de la vida.aumentar el liderazgo y la participación de las mujeres;poner fin a la violencia contra las mujeres;implicar a las mujeres en todos los aspectos de los procesos de paz y seguridad;mejorar el empoderamiento económico de las mujeres;y hacer de la igualdad de género un aspecto central en la planificación y la elaboración de presupuestos nacionales para el desarrollo.Asimismo, ONU Mujeres coordina y promueve el trabajo del sistema de las Naciones Unidas en favor de la igualdad de género y en todos los debates y acuerdos relativos a la Agenda 2030. La Entidad trabaja para lograr un mundo más inclusivo con la igualdad de género como elemento fundamental de los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible. Además, desde el sistema de Naciones Unidas se promueve la colaboración inter-agencial para la implementación de proyectos. En este marco, se crea el Joint SDG Fund con la finalidad de escalar las respuestas hacia el cumplimiento de los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible (ODS) a nivel país, promoviendo la colaboración con los gobiernos y otros socios implementadores. El Joint Fund ha sido diseñado para proveer recursos para invertir en programas y políticas que ayuden a los países miembros a superar los obstáculos que impiden el progreso de los ODS.De acuerdo con los datos de la Encuesta de Empleo y Desempleo, 7 de cada 10 jóvenes se encuentran en la informalidad. Encontrarse en el sector informal de la economía reduce las posibilidades de los jóvenes de ejercer su derecho a una adecuada calidad de vida. Este grupo poblacional no tiene acceso al sistema contributivo de seguridad social, recursos financieros inclusivos ni a mecanismos de formalización de trabajo. Además, para aquellos que tienen hijos o hijas menores de 5 años, no existe cobertura adecuada de servicios de cuidado, lo cual obliga a aceptar trabajos por menos horas y menores salarios. Cuando las mujeres que se encuentran en la informalidad son madres, el 80% deja de trabajar o limita su actividad económica, volver a integrarse a sus actividades económicas les toma más de tres años. Ser mujer incrementa la probabilidad de estar en el sector informal con cargas de trabajo no remunerado. Esta probabilidad es 1.3 veces mayor en hogares pobres.Dada esta realidad, los jóvenes no confían en el sistema económico ni de protección social, lo cual reduce la cohesión social. Ante ello este proyecto busca generar soluciones participativas en conjunto con jóvenes y otros actores. La población objetivo constituye 1.4 millones de hombres y mujeres jóvenes trabajadores que no tienen acceso a seguridad social no contributiva ni contributiva lo que los ubica en una situación de mayor riesgo. El principio de “no dejar a nadie atrás” llama a diseñar sistemas de protección social que sean género y etario sensibles enfocándose en la transición de la economía informal a la formal. En este sentido, considerar la intersección entre género, edad y situación de empleo permitirá generar empleo decente y protección social para este grupo poblacional.Para abordar esta situación, ONU Mujeres, la Organización Internacional del Trabajo -OIT y el Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo – PNUD en conjunto crearon el proyecto “Expandiendo el sistema de protección social a hombres y mujeres jóvenes de la economía informal” con la finalidad de contribuir a la incorporación de la población joven que se encuentra en condiciones de informalidad al sistema de protección social y facilitar su acceso a condiciones de trabajo decente. Este proyecto se llevará a cabo de la mano con instituciones del Estado encargadas de la protección social como el Ministerio de Inclusión Económica y Social y el Instituto Ecuatoriano de Seguridad Social, además de los gobiernos seccionales y de actores del sector privado, la sociedad civil y la academia. En este contexto se implementarán enfoques de innovación para contribuir con el diseño y aplicación de instrumentos de política y herramientas generadoras de información de vanguardia.OBJETIVO DE LA CONSULTORÍAContribuir a identificar y validar los mecanismos para mejorar el cumplimiento del derecho que tienen hombres y mujeres jóvenes a licencias de paternidad y maternidad en el marco de la eliminación de barreras que enfrenta este grupo poblacional en Ecuador.RESULTADO ESPERADO DE LA CONSULTORÍAComo resultado de la consultoría se espera contar con información sistematizada y actualizada sobre experiencias de empresas privadas en Ecuador para apoyar al cumplimiento de las licencias parentales con foco en padres y madres jóvenes.RESPONSABILIDADES DEL/LA CONSULTOR/ADesarrollar la metodología de investigación más adecuada para la ejecución de esta consultoría, tomando en consideración las circunstancias de confinamiento actuales. Realizar investigación documental, cuantitativa y cualitativa para identificar las buenas prácticas para el cumplimiento del derecho de licencias parentales y maternales para jóvenes en la región y el estado de situación en Ecuador. Realizar una revisión de los cambios recientes a las normativas de licencias parentales para dar respuesta a la crisis. Desarrollar eventos en modalidad virtual, con participación de empleadores/as y trabajadores/as para identificar mecanismos e instrumentos para mejorar y promover el cumplimiento de las licencias parentales en Ecuador, considerando la situación de crisis actual. ONU Mujeres apoyará en la identificación de los empleadores y trabajadores para implementar al menos 3 grupos focales de trabajadores y 8 entrevistas a empleadores, considerando sector público y privado, actividad económica, tamaño de la empresa, entre otras variables que se consideren relevantes para el análisis. Elaborar un documento que describa las buenas prácticas identificadas y recomendaciones para incentivar el cumplimiento de las licencias de paternidad y maternidad como lo estipula la legislación laboral ecuatoriana tanto para trabajadores y trabajadoras jóvenes como para sus empleadores, en el marco del cumplimiento de los derechos laborales. Duties And ResponsibilitiesPRODUCTOS ESPERADOS y FORMA DE PAGOEl/La Consultor/a Deberá Presentar Para Su Aprobación, Los Siguientes Productos, En Los Plazos Especificados, En Formato Digital, e Impreso (una Vez Que Esté Aprobado) a ONU MujeresProductosProductos entregablesPeríodo aproximado de entregaPago 1Plan de trabajo y documento metodológico. Este documento contendrá el cronograma de actividades y el detalle de las metodologías a utilizar a lo largo de la consultoría, siendo éstas documental, cuantitativa y cualitativa.A los 10 días calendario desde la firma del contrato10% del valor total del contrato2Estado del arte. Describir las políticas, normativas e instrumentos utilizados en Latinoamérica y otros países para incentivar el cumplimiento del derecho a licencias parentales y maternales de jóvenes trabajadoresA los 25 días calendario desde la firma del contrato20% del valor del contrato3Informe del estado de situación en Ecuador. Este documento contiene: 1) la descripción de la situación del cumplimiento de las licencias parentales y maternales de jóvenes y, 2) descripción de las buenas prácticas para la mejora del cumplimiento de licencias parentalesA los 50 días calendario desde la firma del contrato35%del valor total del contrato4Informe final: informe de recomendaciones para incentivar y promover el cumplimiento de licencias parentales y maternales de jóvenes trabajadores y la propuesta para su mejora, incluyendo cambios normativos y estrategias e instrumentos a ser aplicados en las empresasA los 80 días calendario desde la firma del contrato35%Del valor total del contratoLos pagos se realizarán según los porcentajes señalados en un periodo máximo de 15 días hábiles luego de la entrega de los productos, previamente aceptados en conformidad y validados por ONU Mujeres.SUPERVISIÓN DE LA CONSULTORÍA Y OTROS ASPECTOS LOGÍSTICOSLa supervisión será desarrollada por el punto focal y de coordinación del Proyecto.El/la consultor/a coordinará con la Especialista de Empoderamiento Económico de ONU Mujeres para el desarrollo de esta consultoría, con quien se organizarán las actividades contempladas en el literal D, según sea el caso.Para el buen desarrollo de la consultoría ONU Mujeres presentara a el/la Consultor/a los insumos relevantes necesarios y toda la información que facilite y enriquezca el contexto de el/la consultor/a, incluyendo una revisión de la normativa de licencias parentales y maternales en la región y otros países. La consultoría no contempla viajes, traslados, ni dietas.La presentación de informes deberá sujetarse a las especificaciones y requerimientos establecidos en los presentes términos de referencia.La consultoría se desarrollará sobre la base de suma alzada, y contempla todos los costos asociados al desarrollo de el/los producto/s establecidos.CompetenciesCOMPETENCIASValores de la organización y principios rectoresIntegridadDemostrar la consistencia en la defensa y promoción de los valores de ONU Mujeres en acciones y decisiones, de acuerdo con el Código de Conducta de las Naciones Unidas. ProfesionalismoDemostrar competencia profesional y experiencia en el conocimiento de sus áreas sustantivas de trabajo. Sensibilidad Cultural y Diversidad De ValoresDemostrar reconocimiento de la naturaleza multicultural de la organización y la diversidad de su personal; Demuestra perspectiva internacional, aprecio por la diferencia en valores y aprendizaje de la diversidad cultural. Ética y ValoresCompetencias de la Organización:Demostrar y salvaguardad la ética e integridad. Conocimiento OrganizacionalAsumir el auto desarrollo y toma de iniciativas. Trabajo En EquipoDemostrar habilidad para trabajar en un ambiente multicultural, multiétnico, y mantiene relaciones eficaces con personas de diferentes nacionalidades y antecedentes culturales. Comunica y Comparte InformaciónFacilitar y fomentar una comunicación abierta y esforzarse por tener una comunicación eficaz. Dicho equipamiento, al momento de devolverlo a ONU Mujeres, deberá estar en las mismas condiciones que cuando fue entregado al consultor/a, sujeto al deterioro normal. La persona consultora será responsable de compensar a ONU Mujeres por el equipo dañado o estropeado independientemente del deterioro normal del mismo.ONU Mujeres tendrá derecho a toda propiedad intelectual y otros derechos de propiedad incluyendo pero no limitándose a ello: patentes, derecho de autor y marcas registradas, con relación a productos, procesos, inventos, ideas, conocimientos técnicos, documentos y otros materiales que la persona consultora haya preparado o recolectado en consecuencia o durante la ejecución de la presente consultoría, y la persona consultora reconoce y acuerda que dichos productos, documentos y otros materiales constituyen trabajos llevados a cabo en virtud de la contratación de ONU Mujeres. Sin embargo, en caso de que dicha propiedad intelectual u otros derechos de propiedad consistan en cualquier propiedad intelectual o derecho de propiedad de la persona consultora/contratista: i) que existían previamente al desempeño de la persona consultora de sus obligaciones en virtud del presente contrato, o ii) que la persona consultora/ contratista pudiera desarrollar o adquirir, o pudiera haber desarrollado o adquirido, independientemente del desempeño de sus obligaciones en virtud del presente contrato, ONU Mujeres no reclamará ni deberá reclamar interés de propiedad alguna sobre la misma, y la persona consultora/ contratista concederá a ONU Mujeres una licencia perpetua para utilizar dicha propiedad intelectual u otro derecho de propiedad únicamente para el propósito y para los requisitos del presente contrato.A solicitud de ONU Mujeres, la persona consultora/contratista deberá seguir todos los pasos necesarios, legalizar todos los documentos necesarios y generalmente deberá garantizar los derechos de propiedad y transferirlos a ONU Mujeres, de acuerdo con los requisitos de la ley aplicable y del presente contrato.Sujeto a las disposiciones que anteceden, todo mapa, La propuesta será presentada al supervisor/a y se ajustará según las observaciones y contribuciones recibidas.ADJUDICACION Se Seleccionará Al Oferente Que Obtenga La Mayor Puntuación, Considerando Los Siguientes Coeficientes Para Determinar El Puntaje Combinado, Técnico-económicoCalificación de CV = 40%Propuesta técnica = 30%Propuesta económica = 30% Total  100%REQUISITOS PARA PARTICIPARLa Aplicación Consiste En Dos PasosLos/as interesados/as) deben realizar su aplicación a más tardar el 28de mayo de 2020.Primer paso: Aplicación en línea, a través del sistema (UNDP Jobs) se debe subir (EN UN SOLO DOCUMENTO PDF) i) formulario P-11 completo en español y firmado; ii) copia de cédula de identidad; y, iii) copia/s escaneada del diploma/s que evidencie el cumplimiento del criterio de Formación Académica, todo en UN SOLO DOCUMENTO. Es importante tener en cuenta que el sistema no permite subir más de un documento, por lo tanto, insistimos en asegurarse de cargar debidamente este formulario. En caso de no estar firmado este formulario, o no constar en el sistema, la aplicación no será considerada. La falta del mismo será considerada un incumplimiento por parte del participante.El formulario P-11 puede ser encontrado en el siguiente link: http://www.unwomen.org/en/about-us/employmentSegundo paso: enviar en archivos separados la propuesta técnica y la propuesta económica, debidamente firmados, al correo electrónico: adquisiciones.ecuador@unwomen.org , haciendo referencia al presente proceso de selección. En caso de no estar firmados alguno de estos dos documentos, la aplicación no será considerada.Es importante tener en cuenta que el sistema no permite subir más de un documento, por lo tanto, los archivos conteniendo las propuestas técnica y económica deben enviarse al correo electrónico ya mencionado.ONU MUJERES contactará únicamente a la persona seleccionada.ONU Mujeres está comprometida con la diversidad en el mundo del trabajo en términos de género, raza, etnia, nacionalidad y cultura. Mujeres y demás personas pertenecientes a grupos de afrodescendientes, indígenas, LGBTTI, con discapacidad, que viven con el VIH y otras minorías son incentivadas a presentarse.

Descripción: Supervisar, controlar y desarrollar procesos y programas que ayuden a cumplir los requerimientos de software que el cliente necesita con eficacia y dentro de los límites establecidos.Monitorear y soporte de batch en conjunto con los responsables de la Institución FinancieraDesarrollar solucionas de software en base a los requerimientos del clienteInvestigar mejoras y métodos para llevar a cabo solicitudes de los clientes en temas que no han sido implementados antesAsesorar a los clientes en las necesidades de software financieroRealizar especificaciones funcionales para los clientes que se ajusten al cumplimiento de los requisitos solicitadosRequisitosEstudios Carrera completa en Ingenieria en sistemas, informática o carreras afinesAmplio conocimiento en Oracle, SAP, BPM, Xsell ToolsMinimo 3 años de experiencia en posiciones similares.BeneficiosBeneficios de ley.TransporteAlimentaciónSeguro privadoUtilidadesEmpresa Multinacional de Tecnología, proveedores líderes para Latinoamérica de productos de software y servicios relacionados para instituciones financieras.Misión Asociarnos con negocios financieros para acelerar el crecimiento de su red de valor.Vision  COBIS está ampliamente aosciado con redes de valor de rápido crecimiento.Principios Confiabilidad, Satisfacción al Cliente, Liderazgo e Innovación.Valores Honestidad, Compromiso, Empatía, Calidad, Comunicación, Trabajo en Equipo, Recursividad y Enfoque en Soluciones.
